sections.title: The Core Idea
sections.text: Every skill has three mastery tiers: Novice, Expert, and Master. With each use, the player earns mastery points and unlocks new abilities.

items.text: Novice (0-100 Points): Basic skill with standard effect. Simple but effective.
Expert (100-500 Points): Skill gains a bonus effect or reduced cooldown. First specialization possible.
Master (500+ Points): Unlock 2-3 skill variations. Each variation has a completely different playstyle.

sections.title: Example: Fireball Skill
sections.text:
• Novice: Casts a simple fireball (100 damage)
  • Expert: +20% damage, +10% critical hit chance
  • Master - Variant 1 (Inferno): Fireball explodes causing area damage
  • Master - Variant 2 (Lightning): Faster projectile, pierces enemies
  • Master - Variant 3 (Burn): Sets enemies on fire for damage-over-time

sections.title: Why This System Works
sections.text: Players are rewarded for using their favorite skills. Master variations enable build diversity without complex skill trees. Everyone can develop their own playstyle.

items.text: Clear Progression: Players see exactly how far they are to the next tier.
Replay Value: Players want to try and master all variations.
Balance: All variations are equally powerful, just different in playstyle.
